required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impacts of Online and Group Perinatal Education
clinical_study.official_title: Impacts of Online and Group Perinatal Education: Towards and Optimization of Services

collaborator.agency: Fonds de la Recherche en Santé du Québec

brief_summary.textblock: This project aims to evaluate the impacts of group prenatal education and online prenatal education on health determinants and users' health status.

detailed_description.textblock: Prenatal education is a core component of perinatal care and services provided by health institutions. Whereas group prenatal education is the most common educational model, some health institutions have opted to implement online prenatal education to address accessibility issues as well as the evolving needs of future parents. This prospective cohort study aims to evaluate the impacts of group prenatal education and online prenatal education on health determinants and the perinatal health status of parents. It is part of a larger multipronged study using mixed methods.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 10-20 weeks of pregnancy; 33 weeks of pregnancy
primary_outcome.description: Measured with an adapted version of the Health Pregnancies Knowledge Survey

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10-20 weeks of pregnancy; 33 weeks of pregnancy; 6 weeks after child birth
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with a validated French version of the 12-item General Health Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10-20 weeks of pregnancy; 33 weeks of pregnancy; 6 weeks after child birth
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with a French version of the Breastfeeding Self-Efficacy Scale Short-Form

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10-20 weeks of pregnancy; 33 weeks of pregnancy; 6 weeks after child birth
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with a validated French version of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Self-Efficacy in the Parenting Role
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10-20 weeks of pregnancy; 33 weeks of pregnancy; 6 weeks after child birth
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with a French version of the Parent Expectations Survey

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10-20 weeks of pregnancy; 33 weeks of pregnancy; 6 weeks after child birth
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with a French version of the Parent Expectations Survey
Assessed with a French version of the Oxford Worries about Labour Scale
Assessed with a French version of the Labour Agentry Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Personal Control in Pain Relief during Childbirth
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with a French version of the Personal Control in Pain Relief Scale

arm_group.description: Prenatal education delivered in-person by health and social services centers
Online prenatal education provided or recommended by health and social services centers

intervention.description: Observational study : natural distribution of participants between groups

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria for pregnant women:
- 10-20 weeks of pregnancy
- Living within the targeted geographic territories
- Fluent in French
- Have not given birth previously
Inclusion criteria for partners:
- Partner of pregnant women between 10 and 20 weeks of pregnancy
- Living within the targeted geographic territories
- Fluent in French
Exclusion Criteria:
- Men and women not fulfilling inclusion criteria
